article.headline: Akron 77, Bethune-Cookman 66
article.story: AKRON, Ohio -- Nikola Cvetinovic had 17 points and 11 rebounds to help Akron defeat Bethune-Cookman 77-66 in overtime on Saturday. The Zips (5-4), who trailed by as many as 14, faced a seven-point, 56-49 deficit with 1:44 to play before rallying with the 3-point shot. Akron made three straight 3s, capped by a long-distance shot from Brett McClanahan to tie it at 58 and send it into overtime with 43 seconds left. On the Zips' first overtime possession, Cvetinovic hit a layup for a 60-58 lead, their first of the game. The shot sparked a 10-2 run, highlighted by back-to-back 3s from Steve McNees and McClanahan, to snap a two-game losing skid. Akron was 6 of 19 from 3-point range in the game (31.6 percent), including 2 of 3 in overtime (66.7 percent). The Zips had just 2 of their 11 turnovers after halftime. Alexander Starling led the Wildcats (5-7) with 19 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
